description: Fast. Safe. Simple. Investing in online business has never been easier. The Empire Podcast discusses buying and selling websites, investing in online assets and businesses, and the successes and failures that come with online entrepreneurship. Join thousands of listeners who've chosen to build an online empire.
title: The Empire Podcast - Buying and Selling Websites | Investing in Online Assets and Businesses

episodes.title: EFP 209: How To Buy For Value In 2020
episodes.description:
Who doesn't love a good deal?

But for online businesses, a great deal doesn't always mean buying at the lowest price.

In this episode, Joe and I talk about what a great deal looks like when you're shopping for a digital asset in 2020.

We'll talk about what value looks like and discuss some of the practical things to look out for when you're doing your due diligence, like how many hours you actually need to manage the business, and why you shouldn't go into an uncomfortable niche even if it has loads of potential.

Our featured listing in this episode is for an Amazon FBA business that ticks a lot of these boxes for value. It's not a business we normally list on our marketplace, but there's a lot of opportunity for the right buyer - it's well-balanced, has multi-channel revenue, and could be a great deal for you.

episodes.title: EFP 208: The Contrepreneur Formula With Mike Winnet
episodes.description:
It seems the best way to take down fake gurus is by pulling the curtain down and revealing exactly what they're offering.

That's why in this episode, Joe and I are really excited to speak with Mike Winnet from The Contrepreneur Formula where we discover how he got into the business of calling out contrepreneurs online - you might know some names like Grant Cardone, Dan Pena, and Gary Vee.

We appreciate it's easier to criticize fake gurus instead of giving constructive criticism, which is why Mike's perspective is interesting given his entrepreneurial background that provides the foundation behind recognizing deals that seem too good to be true.

Our featured listing in this episode is for an Amazon Associates business that provides electronic reviews and compares and contrasts products. Traffic is mostly organic, and it's worth noting that declining traffic could be a great opportunity for a buyer to pick up and grow the business.

episodes.title: EFP 207: Massive Funds Buying Up The Market In 2020
episodes.description:
While 2020 has been a rough year around the world, our industry has been booming. We're seeing a lot of activity from partners and groups looking to snap up 6-, 7-, and 8- figure digital assets.

In this episode, Joe and I dive into what the selection criteria for these deep-pocketed groups look like, how they negotiate deals, and what are their ultimate long-term plays.

We also cover why brokers are key in these types of deals and how sellers can benefit from listing on our marketplace.

Stay tuned for two featured listings this week. Both are in the technology niche providing a special type of internet service in different geographic regions, and are potentially great deals for groups looking to buy a business providing a full-time income instead of a full-time job.

episodes.title: EFP 206: Surprising Internet Scammers With YouTuber Pleasant Green
episodes.description:
If you send me a few laptops I'll wire $50,000 to your account tomorrow..."
By now we're all familiar with online scams that appeal to our emotions or a path to get rich with a "small" investment. What if Instead of ignoring or trolling scammers, there was a more wholesome way of dealing with these types of emails?
In this episode, Joe and I talk with Ben Taylor, the man behind the Youtube channel Pleasant Green, who's mission is to identify scams and find ways to help online scammers financially without having to rely on these schemes.
We'll cover what types of scams exist with online businesses, how Ben dealt with these, and how he saw that was a genuine deeper need behind these scams so he could turn these encounters into positive opportunities.
We'll also talk about a solid business that's for sale with lots of diversification in traffic and revenue sources that makes just under $50k in monthly net profit and suits people looking for a really profitable online business without the need to grow one from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 205: How To Manipulate Facebook To Win An Election
episodes.description:
This is a departure from our regular episodes where we talk about buying and selling online businesses, the overall industry, and entrepreneurship in general. 

Today I talk with Michael Erickson from digital marketing agency Search Scientists about how political operatives use Facebook and other major online platforms to manipulate the vote.

We cover what were some of the old school ways that elections could have been manipulated pre-Internet, how big data is used to drive voters towards your candidate (and away from the opposition), and how these tactics might be used in Small Town, USA.

No featured listings or updates for this episode, we'll be back with that on the next one. I hope this serves as a warning to anyone who's missed the looming danger of these platforms being used as a tool to manipulate elections.

episodes.title: EFP 204: What Business Buyers Want In 2020
episodes.description:
2020 remains a seller's market, but there's NO guarantee you'll be able to sell your online business, especially at your perceived value or on your terms.With that said, we can't wait to give you some actionable tips to help you bridge this gap between buyers' expectations and your expected sales price.

In this episode, Joe and I talk about how you can step into a buyer's shoes to understand their wants and needs to give you a better chance to sell your asset.

We'll cover what types of factors are attractive to buyers like how you've established a unique brand, how you've managed to lower risk through diversification, or different ways a buyer can expand your business.

If you're looking for an asset to replace your main income, keep an ear out for when we talk about a SaaS business in the business niche that makes over $16k each month in net profit and has a large team to support with daily tasks.

episodes.title: EFP 203: From Brokering Yachts To Websites
episodes.description:
After this yacht broker found out just how lucrative buying and selling online businesses was, it blew any doubts he had out of the water.

In this episode, Joe and I talk with Zac Zorn who turned his hand to flipping online businesses for a profit.

We'll cover how he came about founding MoneyNomad.com, and discuss how to get started with flipping online businesses with smart tactics based on Zac's personal experience.

We're also excited to share about an Amazon FBA business that's for sale on our marketplace in the gifts niche that's making over $17,000 in monthly net profit and requires few hours a week to maintain (this might be a business to replace your main source of income!).

episodes.title: EFP 202: Brokering Porn Websites
episodes.description:
During the COVID-19 pandemic, traffic for porn increased by 10% worldwide.
But are adult businesses increasing by the same amount across the board?
In this episode, Joe and I talk with Bruce Friedman, a broker in the adult business industry.
We'll compare the state of the adult industry between 2015 and now, which niches are growing or dying out, and issues that are becoming increasingly common among buyers and sellers.
We also go into a bit more detail about a 6-figure advertising and digital product business in the diet niche and why declining traffic presents a potential great growth opportunity.

episodes.title: EFP 201: 4 Ways Sellers Trick Buyers
episodes.description:
"You're going to lose a lot of trust in a buyer if you're overly greedy at the end of deals—don't do it."

Not revealing the whole truth about your business can lead to an adversarial relationship between a buyer and seller.   

In this episode, Joe and I discuss some of the most common tricks sellers use to present their business as a sweetheart deal.

We'll go over why honesty is the best policy when you want the sale to work out well for all parties, and how an online business broker helps you see through the smoke and mirrors.

This week we'll also review two exciting 6-figure businesses on sale right now, as well as go over some excellent news and updates for this quarter—stick with us!

episodes.title: EFP 200: Empire Flippers Values
episodes.description:
In this episode, Joe and I discuss what we learned were some of the most important values when you grow a company.

This week we share what lessons stuck with us as we pivoted and changed companies, and how we made sure that company values played a huge role in our decision making as founders and CEOs to ensure the business grew from strength to strength.

We discuss the benefits of not taking shortcuts, looking at long-term benefits over short-term, and the types of clients we want to do business with along with our other values.

episodes.title: EFP 199: Creating Your Content Marketing Strategy
episodes.description:
In this episode, Joe and I discuss how to build a rock-solid content marketing game plan that you can use for your business.

This week we bare all about how we started creating content, what are some of the lessons we learned along the way, and how we nailed content marketing by being honest in all of the content we produced, even though we were complete beginners in content marketing at the start.

We also discuss how to identify your target audience, what type of content you should create to resonate with readers, and what are some of the more creative strategies to content marketing that we discovered.

episodes.title: EFP 198: Outsourcing And Management With Mads Singers
episodes.description:
In this episode, Justin and Joe sit down and talk with Mads Singers the owner of an outsourcing and managements business that fits business owners with VAs located in the Philippines.

We discuss some of the benefits and cultural differences when it comes to outsourcing work to the Philippines compared to outsourced workers in the U.S.

This episode is great if you're interested in utilizing outsourced VAs and some of the complications you may run into while doing so. For all of this, and a deep dive into the changing market conditions and how to adapt your team management operations to fit the current economic climate listen in below and don't forget to leave us a comment.

episodes.title: EFP 197: Entrepreneurial Couples
episodes.description:
In this episode, Joe and I discuss how building a successful business can be difficult, however, it’s all the more rewarding when you get to celebrate with someone who is both your business partner and your spouse.

This week we sit down with Matt and Liz Raad from ebusinessinstitute.com.au to talk about their experiences in buying and selling businesses in Australia. 

We also discuss some of the challenges you may face deciding how to divide the work load living and working as a couple. For all of this, and a deep dive into the conference and courses business model for those interested in pursuing this as an investment opportunity, listen in below and don't forget to leave us a comment.

episodes.title: EFP 196: Human Proof Designs
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Joe discuss the options you have when considering whether you should build a business from scratch, or purchase a keyword optimized niche site already generating revenue. That’s the proposition over at Human Proof Designs, and we've invited the owner Bryon on the show to discuss his background, how he purchased Human Proof Designs, and even get into some industry gossip as well.

episodes.title: EFP 195: Our Hiring Funnel
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin & Joe go into detail to describe the Empire Flippers hiring process. From the initial application through the onboarding process, get an inside look at how a scaling company hires. You’ll find the show notes at empireflippers.com/hiringfunnel.

episodes.title: EFP 194: The Roofstock Marketplace
episodes.description: Justin and Joe discuss the similarities between Real Estate investing and investing in online businesses. They sit down with Roofstock’s founder, Gary Beasley, for an in-depth interview that covers the founding and scaling of Roofstock, how Roofstock works for both sellers and investors, and the unique challenges that come with running a 2-sided marketplace.

episodes.title: EFP 193: Our 2020 Industry Predictions
episodes.description: Justin and Joe dig into the predictions they made in 2019 to discuss which panned out and which didn’t. They also make some predictions for 2020 in the industry around buying, selling, and investing in online businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 192: Mark Manson On Which Fucks To Give
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin talks with the #1 New York Times bestselling author of The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck, Mark Manson. Mark went from being a relatively obscure blogger to a leading self-help author and bonafide public intellectual. Listen in as they discuss Mark’s story, his framework on deciding what to value in life, and the business side of being a bestselling author.

episodes.title: EFP 191: Online Business That Don’t Sell In 2019
episodes.description: In this episode of the podcast, Justin and Joe talk about the types of online businesses that are NOT selling well in 2019. They get into specific feedback from buyers and offer recommendations that'll help you make your business more sellable. If you're a buyer this is a great episode to learn more about less popular deals to gain more leverage.

episodes.title: EFP 190: Founding Mercury Bank
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin talks with successful startup founder Immad Akhund about his background and latest company — Mercury Bank. Mercury is a bank for startups with benefits that separate it from the competition. Listen in to learn more about how the business got started, its future plans, and what it takes to repeatedly launch successful businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 189: Highlighting 4 Advantages Of Distributed Teams
episodes.description: In this episode of the Empire Flippers Podcast, Justin and Joe highlight the serious advantages of running a team without an office — working from anywhere in the world. Whether you already have an opinion on offices or not, the hope is that this episode will encourage you to seriously consider running a distributed team in your company.

episodes.title: EFP 188: From Newbie Norm To Portfolio Paul With Jaryd Krause
episodes.description: In this episode, Jaryd Krause from Buying Online Businesses joins the podcast to discuss his story of going from a Newbie Norm to a Portfolio Paul as an online business buyer. Jaryd is quickly becoming a player in the industry and shares a lot of valuable insights for those just starting out or those looking to continue growing their online empire.

episodes.title: EFP 187: 7 Habits Of Successful Portfolio Buyers
episodes.description: Portfolio buyers take a professional approach to buying businesses, often owning several or even dozens of businesses. In this episode, Justin & Joe discuss some of the habits of their most successful portfolio buyers to see what they have in common. Listen in to catch all 7 secrets and set yourself up for success.

episodes.title: EFP 186: Business Buyer Bias
episodes.description: In this episode of the Empire Flippers Podcast, Justin and Joe discuss the biases buyers commonly hold when looking at potential businesses. Biases can stand in the way of great opportunities, so listen in as your hosts give alternative views that buyers might want to consider as they conduct due diligence and shop for deals.

episodes.title: EFP 185: The ClickMinded Journey
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Tommy Griffith who went from running SEO at PayPal and AirBnB to sitting in an AirBnb rental in Bali, completely unsure about his next steps. We review how he built ClickMinded from a small, local, in-person training course to an online training platform and uncover his successes and failures along the way.

episodes.title: EFP 184: 4 Entrepreneurial Takebacks
episodes.description: Everything you’ve done has led to where you are today, but are there things in your entrepreneurial career you wish you could take back? In this episode, Justin & Joe dive into 4 issues and discuss how they might do things differently a second time around.

episodes.title: EFP 183: Balancing Pressure And Security
episodes.description: Some entrepreneurs flourish when they don’t have a penny to their name, no income, and a looming deadline. Others need at least 12 months of expenses saved up to feel secure. What’s the difference between the two? Who’s more successful? These are the questions we attempt to unpack in this episode.

episodes.title: EFP 182: Mastering SEO With Matt Diggity
episodes.description: In this episode, we spoke with Matt Diggity about his path to becoming an SEO expert and dig into what’s made him so successful.

episodes.title: EFP 181: Greg Mercer on Growing Jungle Scout
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin interviews Greg Mercer about how he built Jungle Scout into the power-house company it is today and what makes him unique as an entrepreneur.

episodes.title: EFP 180: Scaling ahrefs with Tim Soulo
episodes.description: In this episode, Justin talks with Tim Soulo from ahrefs about how he landed at the company and the details behind how they've scaled the business over the last few years.

episodes.title: EFP 179: Build Or Buy an Online Business?
episodes.description: In this episode we provide a framework you can use to determine whether you should buy an online business or build one from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 178: Why Would you Sell a Profitable Online Business?
episodes.description: This week we unpack 7 reasons sellers give for wanting to sell their online business.

episodes.title: EFP 177: 5 Predictions For 2019
episodes.description: We are looking at trends in our industry and making 5 specific predictions for buying and selling online businesses in 2019.

episodes.title: EFP 176: Rand Fishkin On Moz and the Future Of SEO
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Rand Fishkin from Moz.com to get his thoughts on SEO, scaling SaaS companies, and the value of transparency in business.

episodes.title: EFP 175: From Virtual Assistant To Partner At LeadSpring
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Jay Yap from Leadspring to discuss his journey from Virtual Assistant to Partner.

episodes.title: EFP 174: Avoiding First Time Buyer Pitfalls
episodes.description: In this episode, we look at some of the pitfalls first time buyers fall into and how those newbie buyers can avoid them.

episodes.title: EFP 173: What Would It Take?
episodes.description: What would it take to get better at using intuition in your business? That’s the topic with Michaela Light from Intuitive Leadership Mastery.

episodes.title: EFP 172: Scaling Your Content Marketing With MarketMuse
episodes.description: We sit down with Jeff Coyle from Market Muse to look at new and improving ways to provide content to your prospects and customers.

episodes.title: EFP 171: Buying Online Businesses In 2018
episodes.description: In this episode, we look at some of the industry highlights from 2017 and make some predictions about the market in 2018.

episodes.title: EFP 170: Leveraging Press For Your Exit
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Peter Shankman, founder of HARO, to discuss how press and social media can be used to add value as entrepreneurs.

episodes.title: EFP 169: Growing TaxJar To 9K Customers
episodes.description: We sit down with Mark Faggiano to discuss how he scaled his SaaS business TaxJar to more than 9,000 customers.

episodes.title: EFP 168: Expert Advice On Building, Buying, And Growing Amazon FBA Businesses
episodes.description: We sit down with our friend Scott Voelker from theamazingseller.com to look at how to build, buy, and expand Amazon FBA businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 167: Tim Urban From Wait But Why
episodes.description: We sit down with Tim Urban from WaitButWhy.com to discuss his creative process, procrastination, his meeting with Elon Musk, and how he runs his business.

episodes.title: EFP 166: The Case For Partnerships
episodes.description: There are plenty of reasons partnerships can be a BAD idea. In this episode, we’ll look at the benefits and the 6 types of partnerships that work.

episodes.title: EFP 165: Why Did The Co-Founder Of Lead Pages Walk Away?
episodes.description: In episode 165 we sit down with Simon Payne the co-founder of Lead Pages to discuss how they got started, their process for scaling, and his reasons for exiting the company.

episodes.title: EFP 164: How Monetize More bounced back from losing $2.2M
episodes.description: In episode 164 we sit down with Kean from Monetize More to look at how his company came back from a $2.2M loss when their AdSense account was banned.

episodes.title: Episode 163: How Minaal Leveraged Kickstarter To Become A Lifestyle Brand
episodes.description: In episode 163, we look at the travel brand Minaal, their incredibly successful kickstarter, and their path to turn this into a successful, long-term business.

episodes.title: EFP 162: SaaS Company Splitly Brings On An Investor
episodes.description: In episode 162 we sit down with Andrew from Splitly.com to look at the deal structure he used to bring on a partner/investor.

episodes.title: EFP 161: Building And Scaling Sales Teams
episodes.description: In episode 161 we sit down with Damian Thompson to discuss the importance of sales and how to build and grow sales teams.

episodes.title: Episode 160: The Value Of A Steak Dinner
episodes.description: In this episode, we look at the ROI of steak dinners and networking events and how we use them to grow our business.

episodes.title: Episode 159: Tracking A Virtual Assistant Startup
episodes.description: In this episode we sit down with Tom Hunt from VirtualValley.io to discuss his startup journey and to talk more about hiring virtual assistants.

episodes.title: Episode 158: Navigating The Dips
episodes.description: In episode 158, Joe and I look at 3 specific dips in our entrepreneurial journey and look at how we made it through.

episodes.title: Episode 157: Helping Convicted Felons Find Jobs
episodes.description: In episode 157 we interview Ron Stefanski about how he built an online business around helping convicted felons with jobs.

episodes.title: Episode 156: Due Diligence Framework
episodes.description: In this episode we propose a framework to help with due diligence when buying websites and online businesses.

episodes.title: Episode 155: Greg Mercer: From Amazon FBA To Jungle Scout
episodes.description: We sit down to chat with Greg Mercer from Jungle Scout about his Amazon FBA business and building a 7-figure software company.

episodes.title: EFP 154: Meet The Empire Flippers Team
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down for a round table discussion with our management team at Empire Flippers.

episodes.title: EFP 153: 4 Ways To Own Your Market
episodes.description: In episode 153, Joe and I dig into 4 different ways you can take over and own a market or niche.

episodes.title: EFP 152: Laura Roeder On Growing A SaaS Company
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Laura Roeder about Edgar, a Social Media Management & Scheduling Tool. We discuss her entrepreneurial story and how she was able to build Edgar into a massive brand.

episodes.title: EFP 151: Funding Website Purchases With Lendvo
episodes.description: We sit down with the founders from Lendvo.com to look at their entrepreneurial story and how they provide financing for website buyers.

episodes.title: EFP 150: Quickstart Guide To Building An Amazon FBA Business
episodes.description: Joe and I sit down with Jon Haver from AuthorityWebsiteIncome.com to discuss a great way to quickstart your Amazon FBA business.

episodes.title: EFP 149: Selling Websites In 2016
episodes.description: In this episode, we take a look at what went down in 2015 and make some predictions about the industry in 2016.

episodes.title: EFP 148: Profit First: A Different Way To Look At Business Financials
episodes.description: In episode 148, we look at the Profit First system and how website portfolio owners can implement throughout their business.

episodes.title: EFP 147: Business Model Showdown: Amazon Affiliate Vs. Amazon FBA
episodes.description: In episode 147, Justin and Joe look at the comparisons between the Amazon FBA and Amazon affiliate site business models.

episodes.title: EFP 146: How We're Spending $800K Buying Online Businesses
episodes.description: In episode 146, we look at specific types of sites we’re looking to buy for an $800K portfolio in our investor program.

episodes.title: EFP 145: Building A Business With Bitcoin
episodes.description: In episode 145 we look at the impact bitcoin is making in the business world and talk to Jonathan Chester from BitWage.com.

episodes.title: EFP 144: How To Find Amazing Deals (And Avoid Hunting Unicorns)
episodes.description: In episode 144, Joe and Justin discuss the various ways you can find amazing deals and avoid hunting for unicorns.

episodes.title: EFP 143: Bootstrapping TimeDoctor Into An 8-Figure Company
episodes.description: How Liam Martin from Time Doctor bootstrapped an 8-figure company in just a few short years.

episodes.title: EFP 142: Scaling Content Marketing With Dan Norris From WPCurve
episodes.description: We sit down with Dan Norris from WPCurve to dig into how he’s built a million dollar company on the back of content marketing in less than two years.

episodes.title: EFP 141: CPA Mario Lucibello on Buying and Selling Online Businesses
episodes.description: In episode 141 we sit down with CPA Mario Lucibello to discuss an accountant’s take on buying and selling websites and online businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 140: Purchased Website Flops
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Nick from SideHustleNation.com to discuss his recently purchased website.

episodes.title: EFP 139: Entrepreneurship & The End Of Jobs
episodes.description: In Episode 139 we sit down with Taylor Pearson from TaylorPearson.me to discuss the 4th economy, the rise of entrepreneurship, and his new book, "The End Of Jobs"

episodes.title: EFP 138: Strategic Website Acquisitions
episodes.description: Looking at creative ways for website buyers to look for and find strategic website acquisitions.

episodes.title: EFP 137: Brokering Websites In The Adult Industry
episodes.description: In this episode, we sit down with Bruce Friedman from adultsitebroker.com to discuss the business of buying and selling adult websites.

episodes.title: EFP 136: How We Lost $25K To Russian Scammers Part 2
episodes.description: In episode 26, we sit down with our attorney to discuss our options for dealing with thieves and credit card fraud.

episodes.title: EFP 135: How We Lost $25K To Russian Scammers Part 1
episodes.description: An in-depth look at how Vladislav Smolensev scammed us for just over $25K with stolen credit cards.

episodes.title: EFP 134: Building 6-Figure Sites In Questionable Niches
episodes.description: Justin interviews the owner of Vaped.ca to discuss building a 6-figure eCommerce site from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 133: Why We're Building Our Business Abroad
episodes.description: Joe and I sit down to discuss our reasons for building our business abroad and why we choose to live the expat entrepreneurial lifestyle.

episodes.title: EFP 132: Lessons In Startup Failure From A Harvard Grad
episodes.description: We discuss the successes and failures of a Harvard grad looking to make his way in entrepreneurship.

episodes.title: EFP 131: Crush Your Competition
episodes.description: Joe and I look at a new approach to crush your competition and grow your business.

episodes.title: EFP 130: 10 Proven Tactics for Growing Purchased Websites
episodes.description: Justin and Joe cover 10 proven tactics to expand profitable websites and online portfolios.

episodes.title: EFP 129: Dan Pena On Creating $50 Billion In Value
episodes.description: In today's episode we sit down with Dan Pena to discuss how to be a high-performance person and why today's entrepreneurs are setting their sites too low.

episodes.title: EFP 128: Lifestyle Larry Guide To Job Replacement Income
episodes.description: Joe and I cover some of the tips and tactics Lifestyle Larry can use to build a portfolio of websites and replace his job.

episodes.title: EFP 127: Anatomy Of A Bought And Sold Site
episodes.description: Justin interviewed Ace Chapman about buying and selleng websites as a business model.

episodes.title: EFP 126: Is It Better To Buy Sites Or Build Them?
episodes.description: Justin and Joe sit down to discuss the advantages of buying websites vs. building them from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 125: Cashing In On Future Earnings With OAREX
episodes.description: Justin sits down with Hanna from OAREX.com to discuss ways to cash in on future website profits.

episodes.title: EFP 124: The Rise Of The Apprentice
episodes.description: Justin and Joe get into the rise of the apprenticeship as it relates to entrepreneurs and building your business.

episodes.title: EFP 123: Buyer Postmortem of a 40K Purchase
episodes.description: An interview with a previous buyer about purchasing a website and his attempts to expand.

episodes.title: EFP 122: Our Successes and Failures in 2014
episodes.description: Joe and I cover our successes and failures in 2014 and look at our business plan heading into the new year.

episodes.title: EFP 121: Creating a Drop Ship Lifestyle With Anton Kraly
episodes.description: Anton Kraly from Drop Ship Lifestyle discusses how he's built and sold massive drop shipping empires and created a profitable online course.

episodes.title: EFP 120: 5 Niche Business Ideas We'd Pay For Right Now
episodes.description: Joe and I look into five ideas, dig into the details, look at the problems they solve, and give you an estimate on what they would be worth to us.

episodes.title: EFP 119: Scoring Free Travel With Abroaders.com
episodes.description: Erik Paquet discusses how entrepreneurs can travel the globe for free using "travel hacking" tricks to score free airline miles and hotel stays.

episodes.title: EFP 118: Retaining Employees In Startups
episodes.description: Joe and I work through some of the common complaints and issues employees have in startups and how we think you can address them directly and honestly.

episodes.title: EFP 117: Flipping an Online Subscription Business
episodes.description: Chris Yates and Justin Cooke discuss the sale of Chris' community website that's currently netting $3.9K/mo.

episodes.title: EFP 116: Overcoming Limiting Beliefs As Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: Joe and I look at some of the limiting beliefs we've struggled with and share our journey in overcoming them

episodes.title: EFP 115: Building An eCommerce Brand From Scratch
episodes.description: Mark Brenwall and I talk about his transition from buying and selling websites to building an eCommerce brand from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 114: How to Buy a Website Without Any Cash
episodes.description: Most buyers don't know that they're able to buy websites without cash. Today, we'll look at 6 creative ways to make that happen.

episodes.title: EFP 113: Dirty Little Secrets from Website Brokers
episodes.description: Joe and I sit down to discuss some of the hard truths about our industry and working with brokers in general.

episodes.title: EFP 112: Screw the Nine to Five
episodes.description: Josh and Jill from Screw the Nine to Five dig into how they manage their partnership, marriage, and the details behind their successful lifestyle business.

episodes.title: EFP 111: Divide and Conquer
episodes.description: Joe and I dig into how we split business responsibilities, determine it's time to hire, and ultimately replace ourselves in our own business.

episodes.title: EFP 110: Becoming a Better Dealmaker
episodes.description: Joe and I dig into the strategies we use to find common ground between buyers and sellers and share some of the trickier strategies used to ensure a win-win deal.

episodes.title: EFP 109: Quickstart Guide For New Website Buyers
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about what to look for when buying new websites (as a first time buyer).

episodes.title: EFP 108: Anatomy of a $200K Website
episodes.description: Today, Seth and I talk about his background and what makes his website different from the usual authority affiliates online.

episodes.title: EFP 107: Yep, You're a Wantrepreneur (Here's How to Fix That)
episodes.description: Today, Joe and I talk about six different types of wantrepreneurs and discuss solutions to transition into actual entrepreneurship.

episodes.title: EFP 106: 6 Types of Website Sellers
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about the different types of website sellers and their motivations for selling.

episodes.title: EFP 105: Debate - Local Vs. Distributed Teams
episodes.description: Joe and I debate the advantages and disadvantages to building local vs. distributed teams.

episodes.title: EFP 104: Slaughtering Your Sacred Cows
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about overvaluing vanity metrics and ideas that are holding entrepreneurs back from growing their businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 103: Is Building Your Business in Southeast Asia a Liability?
episodes.description: Today, Joe and I get into some of the liabilities that come with building your business and team in Southeast Asia and some of the ways to mitigate the liabilities.

episodes.title: EFP 102: Downsides To Selling Your Website
episodes.description: Joe and I are looking at some of the downsides that come with selling your website and some solutions to mitigate the pain.

episodes.title: EFP 101: Retail Vs. Wholesale Marketing
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about the value of non-scalable, high touch marketing and making sure customers are treated like gold.

episodes.title: EFP 100: Lessons Learned Building Million Dollar Empires
episodes.description: Joe and I celebrate our 100th episode by bringing on 11 of our previous guests who, when combined, are making 8-figures total.

episodes.title: EFP 99: Building A Brand Empire (With Jordan Harbinger)
episodes.description: We have Jordan Harbinger from The Art of Charm Podcast as a guest today. We talk about Jordan's story and how to build a business brand empire.

episodes.title: EFP 98: Is Your Online Business Defensible?
episodes.description: How defensible is your website or online business? In this episode, we'll look at the characteristics that make up defensibility and cover some of the advantages and disadvantages of various types of businesses.

episodes.title: EFP 97: Turning Cash Flow Into Assets
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about how to make the transition from cash flow to assets and the benefits of the latter.

episodes.title: EFP 96: Your Blog Will Never Be A Business
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about why most blogs will NEVER be a business, unless...

episodes.title: EFP 95: Building A Business Around Live Events - Dan Taylor @ AppsEvents.com
episodes.description: Dan Taylor and I talk about how to build a business around running live events and how to make them profitable.

episodes.title: EFP 94: Pros And Cons Of Baselining Your Business in SEAsia
episodes.description: Joe and I discuss the pros and cons of basing your business and living in Southeast Asia.

episodes.title: EFP 93: Killer Process For Profitable Website Purchases (With Justin Gilchrist)
episodes.description: Justin Gilchrist and I talk about how you can create your own process to finding profitable website purchases.

episodes.title: EFP 92: Do You Want To Partner With Empire Flippers?
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about a new passive income partnership where we'll grow sites that you've purchased for you.

episodes.title: EFP 91: From The LAPD To A Multi-Million Dollar Empire (With Tim Bourquin)
episodes.description: Tim Bourquin and I talk about how he went from a few people meeting every weekend to a multi-million dollar exit.

episodes.title: EFP 90: On Time-Wasting Customers
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about the signs that a potential customer is just wasting your time.

episodes.title: EFP 89: Entrepreneur Vs. Mini-Mogul Approach (With Ace Chapman)
episodes.description: Ace Chapman and I talk about building a business from scratch vs. buying established businesses to grow.

episodes.title: EFP 88: Improving the Salability Of Your Online Business In 2014
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about how you can increase your online business' salability for 2014.

episodes.title: EFP 87: Building eCommerce Mini-Businesses (With StoreCoach's Dave Hermansen)
episodes.description: Dave Hermansen from StoreCoach.com and Justin Cooke talk about building successful eCommerce websites and niche selection.

episodes.title: EFP 86: 5 Concepts Behind Niche Selection They're Not Telling You
episodes.description: Justin and Joe talk about five concepts behind niche selection that no one else addresses in public.

episodes.title: EFP 85: Selling Our Six-Figure Outsourcing Company
episodes.description: Joe and I discuss the details on our six-figure outsourcing company and why we're selling it.

episodes.title: EFP 84: Reviewing 6 Established Website Profit Models
episodes.description: Joe and I review the advantages and disadvantages of six different website monetization methods and share resources on each for further reading.

episodes.title: EFP 83: Targeting Your Nemesis And Stealing Market Share
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about how to grow your own market share by helping yourself to some off of your competitor's plate.

episodes.title: EFP 82: Website Valuations And A 7-Figure Sale (With Drew Sanocki)
episodes.description: Drew Sanocki and I talk about valuing your website and explore Drew's recent 7-figure sale.

episodes.title: EFP 81: The Value of Masterminds
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about how masterminds can bring a lot of value to your business and the directions you decide to take.

episodes.title: EFP 80: The Virtual Assistant's Not Weak - YOU'RE Weak!
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about common frustrations people have with virtual assistants and how to know when it's your fault as well as how to fix the issue.

episodes.title: EFP 79: How To Prepare Your Site For Sale
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about how to plan your site sale and how to list your site for maximum results.

episodes.title: EFP 78: Leveraging Storytelling In Your Business - Interview With Sean Buvala
episodes.description: Today I interview Sean Buvala, a storyteller that teaches companies how to resonate with their audience and attract more clients.

episodes.title: EFP 77: 5 Mindset Changes You Go Through As An Entrepreneur
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about the 5 mindset changes successful entrepreneurs go through.

episodes.title: EFP 76: What Makes A Business?
episodes.description: Joe and I talk about what makes and doesn't make something a business.

episodes.title: EFP 75: How To Decide When To Cut Your Losses
episodes.description: Joe and I share our stories of when we had to cut our own losses and the lessons we learned through these experiences.

episodes.title: EFP 74: The Value Of Injecting Personality Into Your Business
episodes.description: In episode 74, Joe and I talk about the benefits of injecting more of your own personality into your business and we answer some common objections.

episodes.title: EFP 73: From Crushing It To Getting Crushed (With Josh Escusa)
episodes.description: In episode 73, I interview Josh Escusa from Formyourfuture.com and we talk about his astronomical rise to success and lessons learned from losing it all overnight.

episodes.title: EFP 72: 6 Types Of Website Buyers
episodes.description: In episode 72, Joe and I dig into the six different types of website buyers and break down their motivations and interest in purchasing sites.

episodes.title: EFP 71: 7 Things You Should NEVER Outsource
episodes.description: In episode 71, Joe and I talk about the seven things we recommend no one ever, EVER outsource, regardless if it sounds like a good idea on paper.

episodes.title: EFP 70: Overcoming Entrepreneurial Self-Doubt, Insecurity, and Unrealistic Expectations
episodes.description: In episode 70, Joe and I cover the Impostor Syndrome, lack of support from family and friends, and setting realistic expectations.

episodes.title: EFP 69: Cutting Down Bullshit Work And Building Up Business Resilience
episodes.description: In episode 69, Joe and I cover our best tips on cutting down the bullshit and building a business that's resilient.

episodes.title: EFP 68: 6 Business Takeaways From DCBKK
episodes.description: In episode 68, Joe and I sit down to discuss our recent travels and share some of the business takeaways we got from the Dynamite Circle event in Bangkok.

episodes.title: EFP 67: 5 Advantages To A Transparent Business Model
episodes.description: In episode 67, Joe and I go after the "stealth mode" evangelists and lay out our case for rolling with a transparent business model.

episodes.title: EFP 66: Comparing 3 Vastly Different Approaches To Niche Site Creation
episodes.description: In episode 66, Joe and I discuss the advantages and disadvantages between Pat Flynn's approach in the Niche Site Duel 2.0, Spencer Haws, and ourselves.

episodes.title: EFP 65: How To Tell You're Winning (And What To Do Next)
episodes.description: In episode 65, Joe and I cover some of the clear cut signs you're "winning" and get into the details about how to capitalize on your recent successes!

episodes.title: EFP 64: 3 Business Disasters We Wish We Could Take Back
episodes.description: In episode 64, Joe and I get personal and discuss 3 distinct failures we've had through our various businesses.  We go into detail on the mistakes made and lessons learned so that you can avoid them in your business.

episodes.title: EFP 63: Why YOU Should Build Your Business In SEAsia
episodes.description: In episode 63, Joe and I dig into the main reasons YOU need to get out to SEAsia to build your lifestyle business.

episodes.title: EFP 62: How To Hire Your First Virtual Assistant
episodes.description: In episode 62, Joe and I cut through some of the BS and show you exactly how to go about finding and bringing on your first Virtual Assistant hire.

episodes.title: EFP 61: Empire Building Series - Billy Murphy From ForeverJobless
episodes.description: As a part of our new Empire Building series, Joe and I sit down with Billy Murphy from ForeverJobless.com to discuss how he was able to build an eCommerce empire and leverage that into new profit streams.

episodes.title: EFP 60: 6 Gotchas Regarding Service Based Businesses
episodes.description: Joe and I go over some of the gotchas or problems with being a contractor or running a service based business and offer our best tips on how to get around those issues.

episodes.title: EFP 59: Building A Niche Dropshipping Site With Andrew Youderian
episodes.description: In episode 59, Joe and I sit down with Andrew Youderian from eCommerceFuel.com to discuss exactly how to build a niche dropshipping or eCommerce site from scratch.

episodes.title: EFP 58: 8 Tactics To Building A Sellable Website
episodes.description: In episode 58, Joe and I cover a wide range of tactics site builders should implement if they're building the website eventually sell.

episodes.title: EFP 57: How Successful Are Routines For Entrepreneurs?
episodes.description: In episode 57 Joe and I dig into the benefits and drawbacks of establishing routine into your business as entrepreneurs.

episodes.title: EFP 56: Bouncing Back From Failure With Trent Dyrsmid
episodes.description: In episode 56, we sit down with Trent Dyrsmid from BrightIdeas.co to discuss his journey from offline business to online failure to online success and how he turned things around.

episodes.title: EFP 55: Is The 4HWW Still Relevant In 2013?
episodes.description: Joe and I sit down with Damian from Linchpin.net and Dan from the LifestyleBusinessPodcast.com to discuss whether Tim Ferriss's "4-Hour Workweek" is still relevant for us in 2013.

episodes.title: EFP 54: Getting Started - Smashing Through Self-Imposed Barriers
episodes.description: In episode 54, Joe and I discuss how to break through the self-imposed barriers created when starting your own business and heading down the path to entrepreneurship.

episodes.title: EFP 53: Riding The Entrepreneurial Roller Coaster
episodes.description: In episode 53, Joe and I delve into the ups and downs of the entrepreneurial roller coaster and discuss our tactics for maximizing the highs and minimizing the lows in business.

episodes.title: EFP 52: Buying And Selling Websites For Profit
episodes.description: In episode 52, Joe and I sit down with Mark Brenwall to discuss how he's built a lifestyle business in buying and selling websites in less than 10 months and how it allows him the freedom and opportunity to travel the world and work on things he loves.

episodes.title: EFP 51: 7 Action Items For New Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: In episode 51 we cover 7 great tips, tricks, and strategies for new entrepreneurs looking to hit the ground running.

episodes.title: EFP 50: Personal Business Philosophy And Goals
episodes.description: In episode 50, Joe and I look at some of our personal strengths and weaknesses as entrepreneurs and discuss our plans for growth.

episodes.title: EFP 49: The Traveling Lifestyle Business Entrepreneur
episodes.description: In episode 49, Joe and I sit down with Cody McKibben from ThrillingHeroics.com to discuss the value in working and traveling as a lifestyle business entrepreneur.

episodes.title: EFP 48: 8 Characteristics Of A High-Impact Outsourcing Relationship
episodes.description: In episode 48, Joe and I share 8 of the characteristics and secrets that are behind high-impact outsourcing relationships for both onshore and offshore outsourcing.

episodes.title: EFP 47: 8 Strategies To Bake Engagement Into Your Business
episodes.description: In episode 47, Joe and I discuss eight ways business owners and entrepreneurs can build engagement into their business, blogs, and podcasts.

episodes.title: EFP 46: Building Bad-Ass Business Systems With James Schramko
episodes.description: In episode 46, Joe and I sit down with James Schramko from SuperFastBusiness.com to discuss building out bad-ass business systems through software and hiring key people to grow your business and brand.

episodes.title: EFP 45: 6 Unexpected Realities For Startup Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: In episode 45, Joe and I cover 6 of the realities new entrepreneurs face when starting their new venture.

episodes.title: EFP 44: Building A Profitable Business By Leveraging The Philippines
episodes.description: In episode 44, Joe and Justin sit down with Chris Ducker from ChrisDucker.com to discuss how to build and grow a thriving business with support from the Philippines.

episodes.title: EFP 43: 6 Tire-Kicking Strategies For Vetting A Website
episodes.description: In episode 43, Joe and I sit down to discuss 6 time-kicking strategies you can use for vetting websites you're looking to purchase.

episodes.title: EFP 42: Conversion Strategies That Work
episodes.description: In episode 42, Joe and I sit down with Andy Hayes to discuss design and conversion strategies that actually work for niche and authority sites.

episodes.title: EFP 41: Reach Out Vs Hand Out Mindset
episodes.description: In episode 41 we discuss the difference between a Reach Out and a Hand Out and discuss the differences in mindset between employees and entrepreneurs when it comes to answering your own questions.

episodes.title: EFP 40: Branding And Growth Strategies For Startups And Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: Episode 40 is for Startups and Entrepreneurs that are struggling to find their tribe online. We sit down with Ophelie from Flippa.com to find out the strategies she uses to keep their brand growing.

episodes.title: EFP 39: Building Online Businesses Without The Borg
episodes.description: In episode 39 of the newly-branded Empire Flippers Podcast, we cover how to build and grow an online business as non-technical founders.

episodes.title: AFP 38: 5 Marketing Strategies For Non-Marketers
episodes.description: In episode 38 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, Joe and I discuss 5 marketing strategies you can use to promote your business or blog without having to be a "professional marketer".

episodes.title: AFP 37: Squashing The Resistance
episodes.description: In episode 37 we sit down with Dan from the LifestyleBusinessPodcast and Damian from Linchpin.net to discuss aspects of "The Resistance" that are difficult to work through.

episodes.title: AFP 36: 5 Little Known AdSense Features, Tricks, and Hacks
episodes.description: In episode 36 we wanted to cover some of the little-known tips, tricks, and hacks when it comes to optimizing and managing your AdSense account.

episodes.title: AFP 35: Life In The Philippines
episodes.description: In episode 35, Joe and I cover aspects of life in the Philippines including cost of living, cultural differences, attitudes towards expats, and business culture.

episodes.title: AFP 34: Expanding Niche Sites With Pat Flynn From Smart Passive Income
episodes.description: We're very excited to have Pat Flynn from SmartPassiveIncome.com on the show to discuss with us the various ways of expanding niche sites to become an ultimate resource of information.  In this episode, we cover Pat's success with niche sites starting with Green Exam Academy and looking at his Security Guard Training site as an example of an expanded niche website.

episodes.title: AFP 33: Niche Sites Are NOT A Business
episodes.description: In episode 33, Joe and I get into the reasons we actually agree that simply building niche websites is NOT a business and probably not a great business strategy on its own.

episodes.title: AFP 32: 5 Sure-Fire Ways To Level-Up Your Site Content
episodes.description: In episode 32, we cover our most actionable tips and strategies for providing real value with your site content and delivering an excellent resource for your users.

episodes.title: AFP 31: 7 Actionable Strategies For The Marketing Challenged
episodes.description: In episode 31, we give 7 great marketing tips for non-marketers on how to get some action and traffic that will get your business off the ground.

episodes.title: AFP 30: 8 Misconceptions Regarding Site Rankings
episodes.description: In episode 30 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, Joe and I cover some of the common misconceptions regarding rankings and argue some of the conventional wisdom with ranking your sites.

episodes.title: AFP 29: Vital Skills For Internet Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: In episode 29 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, Joe and I discuss and debate the top skillsets we think are required for successful internet entrepreneurs.

episodes.title: AFP 28: Business Idea Faceoff
episodes.description: In episode 28 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, Joe and I debate several different business ideas and scenarios as presented by John The Intern and lay out our strategy for making them successful.

episodes.title: AFP 27: How To Use A Broker To Buy And Sell Websites
episodes.description: In episode 27, we interview website broker Thomas Smale from Flipping Enterprises and dig deep into subjects like building, buying, and selling websites and the business of brokering.

episodes.title: AFP 26: How To Sell Your Websites On Flippa
episodes.description: In episode 26, we cover our BEST tips, tricks, and secrets for getting maximum value, showing you exactly how to sell your websites on Flippa.

episodes.title: AFP 25: Mastering The Art Of Saying No
episodes.description: Episode 25 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast covers the true cost of saying "Yes" to things and shows you why you might want to say No more often.

episodes.title: AFP 24: 13 Misconceptions About Niche AdSense Sites
episodes.description: Episode 24 covers some misconceptions about niche sites, AdSense, and AdSense Flippers as seen from John The Intern's perspective.

episodes.title: AFP 23: Niche Site Newsletters With Matt Paulson
episodes.description: AFP23 An interview with Matt Paulson about using niche websites to build free or premium newsletter subscriptions.

episodes.title: AFP 22: Tracking And Monitoring Niche Websites
episodes.description: In episode 22, we show you the exact tools and processes we use to track and monitor almost 2,000 niche websites on a regular basis.

episodes.title: AFP 21: Scaling Vs Diversification Based On Market Conditions
episodes.description: Episode 21 Deciding whether to scale or diversify your business based on market growth and stability in your particular industry.

episodes.title: AFP 20: Backlinking Interview - Back To Basics With Joseph Archibald
episodes.description: With the recent changes in Google with Panda and Penguin updates, we've turned to Joseph Archibald to discuss specific backlinking strategies that will maximize exposure and rankings for niche websites.

episodes.title: AFP 19: Interview Funnel: Screening Qualified Employees
episodes.description: Episode 19 delves into how to setup an interview funnel that captures the most qualified potential candidates and shows you how to avoid wasting your time by disqualifying early.

episodes.title: AFP 18 Quality Questions With Actionable Answers
episodes.description: Episode 18 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast covers specific questions from readers and listeners about the business, KW research, and other topics associated with niche site creation.

episodes.title: Episode 17 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Skill Transfer Mastery
episodes.description: In episode 17 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast we share our secrets for mastering the skill transfer process with onshore employees and offshore VA's.

episodes.title: Episode 16 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Sweeping Aside Distractions
episodes.description: In episode 16, we cover the one-off and recurring business distractions that can suck up your time and keep you from hitting your goals and how best to address them.

episodes.title: Episode 15 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Keyword Research - First Page Analysis
episodes.description: In episode 15, we review our BEST tips, tricks, and strategies for determining our chance to rank on the first page of Google and the top indicators and warning signs we use to help us pick better keywords.

episodes.title: Episode 14 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Monetizing Free
episodes.description: Episode 14 is all about the free business model.  We cover advantages, disadvantages, ways to monetize, and how we implement these strategies in our business.

episodes.title: Episode 13 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Cashing In Through Expanding Purchased Sites
episodes.description: Episode 13 is all about how to cash in through the expansion of purchased niche sites.  We interview Chris Guthrie as he guides us through the process of purchasing and then determining the best way to increase earnings on a variety of niche websites.

episodes.title: Episode 12 AdSense Flippers Podcast: The Fourth Wave In Internet Marketing
episodes.description: In episode 12 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, we get into details about how we're moving into a 4th wave in internet marketing.  We cover the trends and transitions that are ocurring in the industry and then give you some exact examples regarding how you can put this to work for you in your business.

episodes.title: Episode 11 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Maximizing Efficiency For Internet Entrepreneurs
episodes.description: Episode 11 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast is all about maximizing your efficiency as an internet entrepreneur.  We cover the differences and challenges in moving from task-based to project-based management, when and how to say no to money or projects, and our best tips for daily schedule management.

episodes.title: Episode 10 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Our Business Failures And Lessons Learned
episodes.description: In episode 10 we cover some of our business failures and the lessons we've learned through multiple industries and companies.

episodes.title: Episode 9 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Ultimate Guide To Outsourcing
episodes.description: In episode 9 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast, we cover everything you'll need to know to build a rockstar outsourcing or VA team and give direct examples of what has and has not worked for us here in the Philippines.

episodes.title: Episode 8 AdSense Flippers Podcast: AdSense Ad Units, Layouts, And Strategies
episodes.description: In this episode we cover Ad Units, Ad Layouts and strategies, hard data from our niche sites, and some do's and don'ts when it comes to your AdSense ads and layouts.

episodes.title: Episode 7 AdSense Flippers Podcast: The Transparent Business Model
episodes.description: www.adsenseflippers.com  Episode 7 goes into detail about the Old Vs. New approach to business when it comes to a tranparent business model.  Topics discussed include the job or career market, open vs. closed systems, and free vs. paid information.

episodes.title: Episode 6 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Partnerships In Internet Marketing
episodes.description: Episode 6 covers some of the benefits and challenges when in a partnership for Internet Marketing. We include some of the practical Do's and Don'ts and our experiences with Partnerships.

episodes.title: Episode 5 AdSense Flippers Podcast: Content Creation And Sourcing For Niche Websites
episodes.description: Episode 5 covers the basics regarding the content sources we use, the process we use to test the content, and the management of the overall process regarding content for niche websites.

episodes.title: Episode 4 AdSense Flippers Podcast: How To Find And Fund Your True Passion
episodes.description: Episode 4 from AdSenseFlippers.com  is about building vision and staying motivated when what you're doing is not terribly exciting.  Building niche websites is not exciting in itself but can lead you down other paths you're passionate about.

episodes.title: Episode 3: AdSense Flippers Podcast - Buying Killer Websites While Not Getting Scammed
episodes.description: Episode 3 of the AdSense Flippers Podcast focuses on the advantages and disadvantages of buying websites online.  We look at the reasons why buying a website might be a good idea, how to set goals when you're considering a purchase, and some steps you can take to get maximum value out of your purchase without getting scammed by the seller.

episodes.title: AdSense Flippers Podcast Episode 2: Our Story And Planned Escape From The Cubicle
episodes.description: AdSense Flippers Podcast Episode 2 covers our journey in escaping from the cubicle, setting up an offshore outsourcing company in the Philippines, and ultimately getting into the business of creating niche websites for profit through the AdSenseFlippers brand.

episodes.title: Episode 1: AdSense Flippers Podcast
episodes.description: This FIRST episode of the AdSense Flippers Podcast has a very special interview with Spencer regarding the keyword tool Long Tail Pro. We cover Spencer's journey in creating niche websites, his overall strategy, and his top tips and tricks regarding keyword research.
